services.title: Industrial Architectural & Engineering Design
services.shortDescription: We are specialized in designing and planning of industrial buildings or infrastructure with quality standards for production or human use.
services.description:
We are specialized in designing and planning of industrial buildings or infrastructure. When it comes to planning, we have to ensure quality standards to make sure it is safely built for production or human use. Industrial architects are responsible for the design and planning of the following: warehouses, factories, processing plants and much more.

From greenfield projects to facility expansions, our team brings together expertise in architecture, structural engineering, MEP systems, and process requirements to deliver integrated solutions.

faqs.question: What types of industrial facilities do you design?
faqs.answer: We design a wide range of industrial facilities including manufacturing plants, warehouses, logistics centers, processing units, and specialized facilities for automotive, pharmaceutical, food & beverage, and other industries.

faqs.question: Do you handle statutory approvals?
faqs.answer: Yes, we provide complete support for obtaining necessary approvals from local authorities, pollution control boards, fire departments, and other regulatory bodies.

faqs.question: Can you integrate existing equipment layouts?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. We work closely with process engineers and equipment suppliers to ensure our designs accommodate specific machinery and process requirements.

services.title: Project Management
services.shortDescription: Leading the work of a team to achieve all project goals within given constraints of scope, time and budget.
services.description:
Project management is the process of leading the work of a team to achieve all project goals within given constraints. This information is usually described in the project documentation created at the beginning of the development process. The primary constraints are scope, time and budget.

We manage and provide consultancy for all aspects of the company's industrial architectural design with experience across diverse project types.

faqs.question: What is included in your project management scope?
faqs.answer: Our scope includes planning, scheduling, cost management, quality control, safety oversight, vendor coordination, progress reporting, and complete project documentation.

faqs.question: How do you ensure projects stay on schedule?
faqs.answer: We use detailed project schedules with critical path analysis, regular progress monitoring, proactive issue resolution, and effective resource management to maintain timelines.

faqs.question: Do you manage specialized contractors?
faqs.answer: Yes, we coordinate all contractors including civil, MEP, HVAC, fire fighting, electrical, and specialized system installers.

faqs.question: What types of interiors do you design?
faqs.answer: We design corporate offices, commercial showrooms, reception areas, meeting rooms, cafeterias, and executive spaces. We also handle industrial office spaces within manufacturing facilities.

faqs.question: Do you provide furniture and fixtures?

faqs.question: Can you work with our existing contractors?

As your design-build partner, we take complete responsibility for your project, coordinating all aspects from initial planning through final handover.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of design-build?
faqs.answer: Design-build offers faster delivery, cost savings through integrated planning, reduced change orders, single-point accountability, and better communication between design and construction teams.

faqs.question: Is design-build suitable for all project types?
faqs.answer: Design-build works well for most industrial and commercial projects. It's particularly beneficial when fast delivery and cost certainty are priorities.

faqs.question: How is pricing structured in design-build?
faqs.answer: We typically offer either lump-sum pricing or guaranteed maximum price contracts, providing cost certainty while allowing for value engineering opportunities.
